channel.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
channel.description:
since when is posting vulgar comments towards a spam bot/advertiser against the rules? it certainly isn't spamming, it's completely relevant. i know there is a rule in regards to showing respect to members of the community, but a person like this shouldn't be considered a part of the community, especially if he/she has 2 posts (that are identical and advertise). it's not like the comment encourages people to visit said advertised site, in fact it's a deterrent if anything; hell, it even lets the advertiser know he/she is not welcome.
i am making this thread not to get the silly 20% warning revoked, but to help the community and myself better understand the rules (therefore shouldn't be handled privately). in the event that a mod sees this and believe the ruling was unjust (which i do believe it was), feel free to lower the warning for funsies. hell, i even reported the post ;)
yours truly, t4 & aff

item.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:20, topic:434519”]in the event that you feel a moderator has touched you inappropriately you should first scream “No!” and push the moderator hands away then talk to an adult! (Admin)[/quote]t4 likes it when i touch him

[quote=“t4, post:21, topic:434519”]once again, the point of this topic isn’t to argue my current moderation status. i sort of have the feeling that you’re convinced it infact, is.[/quote]I’m just going to assume that you’re then asking about what spam is, in which case it’s mod discretion like Silab said, and then people can argue that fact if they feel it was unjust. Pretty simple

Read full topic

item.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:434519”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=537231.msg3928026#msg3928026 date=1330402133]

but that’s the thing there is no unified idea of spam its the moderators decision. also everyone needs to take a step back and understand the term warning its not a punishment its letting you know that a moderator didn’t like what you posted.

what a little authoritarian regime we’ve got here nah, just being an ass now. i will make sure in the future my posts are what you like!

yeah, please send me copies of all posts so i can review them before posting thanks.
[/quote]we just call that a moderation, i could set that up for you[/quote]
thanks but no I rarely moderate as it is, I just abuse my powers from time to time.

As for the entire topic I always clash with Taharok when it comes to subjects like this, in a perfect world yes everything should be discussed and we should have some sort of unified rules, However this is an online community and out of moderating experience I have found this setup to be rather impossible as it imposes a hell of a lot of work on the “volunteer” mods, the community is very solid usually problems get worked out and we rarely have issues with a moderator “abusing” a member. in the event that you feel a moderator has touched you inappropriately you should first scream “No!” and push the moderator hands away then talk to an adult! (Admin)

Read full topic

item.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:13, topic:434519”][quote author=Aff link=topic=537231.msg3928018#msg3928018 date=1330401939]

but that’s the thing there is no unified idea of spam its the moderators decision. also everyone needs to take a step back and understand the term warning its not a punishment its letting you know that a moderator didn’t like what you posted.

so if i were a mod and i didn’t like that post, i could warn you because i think it’s not giving me what i want (your actual idea of spam)?
[/quote]
yes, and if you have a problem with it you can bring it up with the moderator not make a post bitching about it. If the moderator is “abusing” you bring it up with an admin.[/quote]

but abuse is also a term that can be interpreted differently - this is all too confusing for my little 6-year-old mind!

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:434519”][quote author=Aff link=topic=537231.msg3928018#msg3928018 date=1330401939]

but that’s the thing there is no unified idea of spam its the moderators decision. also everyone needs to take a step back and understand the term warning its not a punishment its letting you know that a moderator didn’t like what you posted.

so if i were a mod and i didn’t like that post, i could warn you because i think it’s not giving me what i want (your actual idea of spam)?
[/quote]yup

obviously you could then take it up with another moderator (NOT IN A POST LIKE SOME STUPID PEOPLE THOUGH, READ THE RULES) and then there would probably be a discussion about it

EDIT - lol silab[/quote]

but a discussion is what aids in the development of a community! it allows for all members to gain perspective!

Read full topic

item.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

hm, well thanks for keeping this open - it would have been all too easy for a mod to come along and just lock this . i really do suggest, however that you staffers rework the rules - it’s a little frustrating to see unequal treatment of users and unequal interpretations of the rules, ie what’s acceptable to someone may not be to another; hell, the other side (moparisthebest.com) is COMPLETELY different as far as regulation goes.

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:7, topic:434519”]OP stop being a fag and continue working on your server.

Moderators have the right to use their own judgement in certain cases, obviously flaming a spam bot is about as useful as this thread.[/quote]
i smell sarcasm in the first part, are you flaming me Miss Silabsoft?

oh, you’ve warned me - that’s cute too. (or at least i assume it was you)

Read full topic

item.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:434519”]Spamming in rule breaking threads is no different than spamming in normal threads, and you’ll get infracted for it

Love from Davidi2

xoxoxoxoxox

EDIT - I lowered yours it wasnt as bad as Aff’s[/quote]

to be fair, i was mocking the advertiser to demonstrate how poor his english skills were; if he received the hint, he would understand to post his link in a fashion that provides a question about the site towards the community that provokes discussion. it may have been unreasonably implicit, but the truthful meaning was there

ps i’m still unsure of what spam is - as i stated, i had no negative intentions in my post. i assume that spam is anything off-topic that doesn’t regard the topic at hand (which is still considerably vague and isn’t even stated in the community rules), but can you please clarify this for me? i would more than likely be willing to cease my not-so-helpful “spam” if you could give me a proper definition of what spam is. thanks

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:7, topic:434519”]OP stop being a fag and continue working on your server.

Moderators have the right to use their own judgement in certain cases, obviously flaming a spam bot is about as useful as this thread.[/quote]

every person has a different idea of what spam is. it would be helpful for the community if we could get a statement from someone that provides us with a universal definition of what flame/spam/useful posts are

Read full topic

But yes, a lot of the time people just go around spamming, and they get infracted. cough Stupit’s infraction log cough

item.dc:creator: @T41 t4

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

after carefully looking at the rules, what is spam? can you clarify that? it’s pretty vague.

i’m not trying to troll or be an ass, this is a serious question. imo and most people’s opinion, spam would be something like ‘LOL I LEIK COCKS’ as a reply.

item.title: Hello moparscape mods :)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

since when is posting vulgar comments towards a spam bot/advertiser against the rules? it certainly isn’t spamming, it’s completely relevant. i know there is a rule in regards to showing respect to members of the community, but a person like this shouldn’t be considered a part of the community, especially if he/she has 2 posts (that are identical and advertise). it’s not like the comment encourages people to visit said advertised site, in fact it’s a deterrent if anything; hell, it even lets the advertiser know he/she is not welcome.

i am making this thread not to get the silly 20% warning revoked, but to help the community and myself better understand the rules (therefore shouldn’t be handled privately). in the event that a mod sees this and believe the ruling was unjust (which i do believe it was), feel free to lower the warning for funsies. hell, i even reported the post

yours truly,
t4 & aff

Read full topic
